intro: Veronica utahensis, commonly known as Utah speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of tiny, delicate flowers. Veronica utahensis is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
